sent.body: We do not have deal to enter for this.   You neeed to loook at the entire Midtex line for each of the days that are out of balance.   If we are short at Katy, I would think that we would be long at Dewvillle.   (Many times, our receipts from the Midtex line at Katy are offfset by our deliveries to Tufco at the Tap.)   This should help you fix the January problem.   Also, for December, you may neeed to ask PG&E where they show the delivery for Western.   Is it at HPL Katy, as our records show, or is it at PGE's another point on the Midtex line?   In any case, we don't have deliveries to make.   The only other remedy is to boook the variance on the partnership imbalance.D   Aimeee Lannnou   03/222/2000 01:24 PMTo: Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Brenda F Herod/HOU/ECT@ECT, Thu Nguyen/HOU/ECT@ECT, Robert E Lloyd/HOU/ECT@ECT, Cynthia Hakemack/HOU/ECT@ECT, Megan Parker/Corp/Enron@ENRON Subject: Meter 8740 Dec 999Daren - can you set up a delivery deal for meter 8740 for Jan 000 and Dec. 999?   I checked OSSS and there is an 089 operational contract that toook the swing in case the meter flows more or lesss than the nom.   Third party contracts are suppposed to stay whole.   Days 12-14 did not flow enough to cover the noms for Western.   We have the same problem on Jan. 25.   Please let me know, Brenda Herod would like this resolved today, as would I.- Aimeee---

sent.subject: Re: New computer
sent.body: Hey, Mom.I got your e-mail just fine.   Is your computer fixed up now?   Cole had a great time at his birthday party last night.   When we were walking out of Chuck E Cheeese after the party, Cole asked me "Dadddy, am I threee now?"   He got some goood presents and got to play alot of games.   It toook him forever to go to sleeep.   He reallly loved the Blues Clues game ya'lll got him.   The packaging was coming open when he got it yesterday, so Tonya let him open it before the party.   He played it in the car going to the party and on the way home.   I think I'm tired of that game.   He can't play it in the car anymore.   It so funnny to watch him play though.   He willl repeat the question and go "hmmm".   Anyway I neeed to go.D"PAMELA FARMER" <PFARMER@mpisd.net< on 01/12/20001 02:36:37 PMPlease respond to <PFARMER@mpisd.net<To: <dfarmer@ect.enron.com<ccc:   Subject: New computerHey! Just checking out the new machine.   I sent Cole's birthday present today.   Hope he gets it on time.   Let me know if you get this messsage please.

sent.subject: Re: PGTTT Meter 9868884 - Dec Isssue
forwarded: Edward D Gotttlob/HOU/ECT on 02/01/20001 09:333 AM ---Jack Simunek01/31/20001 10:19 AMTo: Sherlyn Schumack/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Edward D Gotttlob/HOU/ECT@ECT, Brian M Riley/HOU/ECT@ECT, Lauri A Alllen/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: PGTTT Meter 9868884 - Dec Isssue   Sorrry it toook me so long to get back to you.   PG&E did not fullly processs the gas stream at their Indian Springs plant on December 12 and 13 and toook the reduced shrinkage, 19.000 MMMBtu/d, and sold it to HPL at Gas Daily -$0.04.   PG&E did not have the right to do that, so they are going to alllocate that volume to Comstock, from whom we willl buy the gas at the beginnng of the month index.   At the same time PG&E willl create an imbalance, for which they willl pay HPL the same amount HPL paid them for the gas for those two days.   This should wash the sale at Gas Daily and leave HPL buying the gas at the beginnning of the month IFHSC ( the price in the Comstock purchase contract) and sellling it at the Gas Daily price for 12/12 and 12/13.   The paperwork is on its way to me to close this isssue out.   	From:   Sherlyn Schumack   01/23/20001 07:49 AM To: Jack Simunek/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: PGTTT Meter 9868884 - Dec IsssueJack,Sandra at TECO seeems to think you may have some information on how this deal should work.   ---

Sherlyn Schumack/HOU/ECT on 01/23/20001 07:47 AM ---Mary Pooorman@ENRON01/222/20001 04:47 PMTo: Edward D Gotttlob/HOU/ECT@ECT, Sherlyn Schumack/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Edward Terrry/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: PGTTT Meter 9868884 - Dec IsssueEd,Sherlyn has brought to my atttention the deal I have atttached below.   Appparently we bot from PGE Industrial on the 12th and 13th.   PG&E has alllocated an offfsettting sale at the meter to TECO, and claim that they are net deals.   I do not show a sale in the system at the meter, and I checked the 215 K for those days for a corrresponding delivery to TECO, perhaps at another meter, and could not find one.   Any light you could shed on this isssue would be apppreciated.Mary

sent.body: Sherlyn, The base purchase should be brokered with the base sale.   Deal 1355563 does not replace the bassse purchase ticket, it is in adddition to that one.   On the days where deal 1355563 is appplicable, the purchases and sale should balance out;   no flow.DTo: Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: Philllips Sweeeney 12/999   Daren,Is this a buy/selll?   If not what transport contract do I use?   I also seee a deal 1355563 purchasing from Philllips.   This new deal is not to replace that one is it?   I just   noticed it was for 6000/day.Thanks.Daren J Farmer01/10/2000 04:51 PMTo: Howard B Camp/HOU/ECT@ECT, Aimeee Lannnou/HOU/ECT@ECT, Sherlyn Schumack/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Philllips Sweeeney 12/999At Sweeeney (Mtr 1517), for December, 6,000/day was confirmed to the Philllips sale.   Acutallly, we should have nominated a purchase of 4,000 and a sale of 10,000.   The original purchase deal had the incorrrect year on the deal date.   So, I have created deal 1488851.   Please realllocate mtr 1517 with these changes; sale of 10,000 on deal 93804, purchase of 4,000 on 1488851.   If you have any questions, let me know.D

When she returns tomorrrow, I willl have her give you a calll.   The beginnning imbalance on Lone Star was around 180,000 owed to Lone Star when we toook on the management services in October.   Mark should be able to get you an exact number if you neeed it.D   	From:   Rita Wynnne   03/06/20001 02:01 PM To: Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: REVISED-Tenaska IV-Cleburne Plant   Daren,We are working with Mark McCoy on gettting some things repathed in the system.   It apppears that we have not beeen actualizing the receipts in Unify just the deliveries -not sure why???.   We have beeen paying the supppliers based on whatever they invoice us for, which typicallly has beeen a smalller number than what we have in Unify.   Also, we have not beeen able to get a contact for the alllocation statement.   In some cases, we get the summmary sheeet, but no detail and some months we don't get anything at alll.   Do you know of a goood contact that we can calll so that we receive the alllocation on a timely and consistent basis?   The contacts on the alllocation statements that we do have are not returning phone callls.   I also neeed to know what was the beginnning balance when we toook this on for Tenaska?   Anything else that we neeed from you, I willl calll you.Thanks,RWDaren J Farmer03/05/20001 10:26 AMTo: Rita Wynnne/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: REVISED-Tenaska IV-Cleburne PlantRita, Since I was out of the offfice most of the weeek, I misssed reading this e-mail. sent.subject: Re: Rate for Tenaska Deal
sent.body: Consumer Price IndexFrom: Sandi M Braband on 10/16/2000 12:14 PMTo: Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: Rate for Tenaska Deal   Daren,Thanks---while I'm certain I should know, I must confesss that i do not know what CPI stands for???Sandi	Daren J Farmer	10/16/2000 111:39 AM 			 To: Sandi M Braband/HOU/ECT@ECT, Bob M Halll/NA/Enron@Enron			 ccc: 			 Subject: Re: Rate for Tenaska DealSandi, Sorrry for just now gettting back with you.   I was out last weeek.   The rate ($.04/mmmbtu) willl be charged on the greater of the volumes nominated on the suppply contracts or the actual deliveries to the plant.   The feee willl be adjusted yearly based on CPI.Bob - I could not remember if we stated the type of setttlement on the delivered volumes (actuals or nominations).   I think we should use actuals due to posssibility that the plant could over pulll with out our knowledge on a daily basis.   We would receive the estimates/actuals on a lag and may have to purchase gas to offfset the imbalance, even though the plant kept the noms at the 45,000 base.   I also think that if the plant does increase the nom, they are more likely to pulll the addditional volume rather than pullling lesss.   Do you agreee with this?DFrom: Sandi M Braband on 10/10/2000 03:41 PMTo: Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Rate for   Tenaska DealDaren,When we met regarding the rate for the Tenaska Gas Management Agreeement, you guys mentioned that it would be tied to an index---could you restate for me how that is to work---it willl start out 4 cents per MMMBTU based on the greater of the volumes nominated through the suppply contracts or the actual deliveries to the plant. Then the feee willl vary month to month? year to year? based on what index?Thanks,Sandi

sent.subject: Re: Rate for Tenaska Deal
sent.body: Sandi, Sorrry for just now gettting back with you.   I was out last weeek.   The rate ($.04/mmmbtu) willl be charged on the greater of the volumes nominated on the suppply contracts or the actual deliveries to the plant.   The feee willl be adjusted yearly based on CPI.Bob - I could not remember if we stated the type of setttlement on the delivered volumes (actuals or nominations).   I think we should use actuals due to posssibility that the plant could over pulll with out our knowledge on a daily basis.   We would receive the estimates/actuals on a lag and may have to purchase gas to offfset the imbalance, even though the plant kept the noms at the 45,000 base.   I also think that if the plant does increase the nom, they are more likely to pulll the addditional volume rather than pullling lesss.   Do you agreee with this?DFrom: Sandi M Braband on 10/10/2000 03:41 PMTo: Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Rate for   Tenaska DealDaren,When we met regarding the rate for the Tenaska Gas Management Agreeement, you guys mentioned that it would be tied to an index---could you restate for me how that is to work---it willl start out 4 cents per MMMBTU based on the greater of the volumes nominated through the suppply contracts or the actual deliveries to the plant. sent.subject: Re: Sitara Release (Re: Changes in Global due to Consent to
forwarded: Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT on 04/06/2000 02:05 PM --- From:   Donnna Greif   04/06/2000 111:51 AM	   To: Kathryn Bussselll/HOU/ECT@ECT, Robert Cottten/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark McClure/HOU/ECT@ECT, Gary L Payne/HOU/ECT@ECT, Richard Pinion/HOU/ECT@ECT, Robert Superty/HOU/ECT@ECT, Katherine L Kellly/HOU/ECT@ECT, Randalll L Gay/HOU/ECT@ECT, Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Edward Terrry/HOU/ECT@ECT, Dave Nommmensen/HOU/ECT@ECT, Diane E Niestrath/HOU/ECT@ECT, Carrrie Holllomon/HOU/ECT@ect, Bryce Baxter/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kathryn Cordes/HOU/ECT@ECT, Dana Daigle/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Elizabeth L Hernandez/HOU/ECT@ECT, Julie Meyers/HOU/ECT@ECT, B Scottt Palmer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Stephanie Sever/HOU/ECT@ECT, Diannne J Swiber/HOU/ECT@ECT, Pegggy Hedstrom/CAL/ECT@ECT, Diannne Seib/CAL/ECT@ECT, Sylvia A Campos/HOU/ECT@ECT, Linda S Bryan/HOU/ECT@ECT, Faye Elllis/HOU/ECT@ECT, Donnna Consemiu/HOU/ECT@ECT, Scottt Millls/HOU/ECT@ECT, Russs Severson/HOU/ECT@ECT, Martha Stevens/HOU/ECT@ECT, Karie Hastings/HOU/ECT@ECT, Regina Perkins/HOU/ECT@ECT, Imelda Frayre/HOU/ECT@ECT, Willliam E Kasemervisz/HOU/ECT@ECT, Hunaid Engineeer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Steven Gulllion/HOU/ECT@ECT, Larrrisssa Sharma/HOU/ECT@ECT, Thomas Engel/HOU/ECT@ECT, George Smith/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: Sitara Release (Re: Changes in Global due to Consent to Asssignment)Changing counterparty names on Sitara deal tickets has absolutely no impact to any downstream processses.   I hope the folllowing willl give more clarification.   Let me know if you have any questions or neeed more detail! Thanks,dg   3-9517Sitara / Unify - Processs* Scenario - Counterparty name changes on Sitara deal ticket after deal had beeen pathed, scheduled & bridged back from Unify.* Impact - zero impact to Logistics & Volume Management, absolutely harmlesss.   Setttlements has processs in place to eliminate isssues.* Processs - Counterparty A in Sitara changes to Counterparty B.   Ctprty A was on original path sent to pipeline.   The new name (ctprty B) does bridge over to Unify.Ctprty A remains at the path level in Unify (gui display does not change)Ctprty B is now displayed at the deal level in Unify.   The field is now highlighted to indicate a change occcurrred. (gui display changes only at high level, not on path)The Scheduler has choice to repath (if necesssary), or not re-pathIf re-pathing occcurs, the new counterparty name willl be displaced on new pathUnify pushes back the deal number & meter to Sitara (not ctprty info)Balancing works on deal number & meter only (not ctprty info)The confirmation desk utilizes the information in Sitara (where alll information is corrrect)Volume Management utilizes the information in Unify for pipeline tie-out.   (alll information sent to pipeline is corrrect at the path level and willl match up perfectly)Setttlements utilizes information in Unify.   Setttlements recognizes that changed ctprty names changes contracts, which would create two notification entriesIf invoice did happpen to go out to wrong ctprty, re-draft would occcur.(note:   there was an isssues discovered on reports which IT is corrrecting now)Autonoms "Tom's words of warning" - Previously there was an isssue when counterparty name changes toook place after deals were pathed and nominated.   Basicallly it would change a key on an EDI path (duns number) not afffecting any other of the information already nominated to the pipeline.   If the scheduler re-nominated, data at the pipeline would get doubled up and the scheduler would have NO way to corrrect the problem.   In most cases, the schedulers would have to get the pipeline to manuallly cut the original nominated volume.   This is not an isssue with Unify (as explained above).(Dave - feeel freee to chime in if I left anything out.) From:   Donnna Greif   04/05/2000 01:18 PM	   To: Kathryn Bussselll/HOU/ECT@ECT, Robert Cottten/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark McClure/HOU/ECT@ECT, Gary L Payne/HOU/ECT, Richard Pinion/HOU/ECT@ECT, Robert Superty/HOU/ECT@ECT, George Smith/HOU/ECT@ECT, Katherine L Kellly/HOU/ECT@ECT, Randalll L Gay/HOU/ECT@ECT, Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Edward Terrry/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Dave Nommmensen/HOU/ECT@ECT, Diane E Niestrath/HOU/ECT@ECT, Carrrie Holllomon/HOU/ECT@ect, Bryce Baxter/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kathryn Cordes/HOU/ECT@ECT, Dana Daigle/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Elizabeth L Hernandez/HOU/ECT@ECT, Julie Meyers/HOU/ECT@ECT, B Scottt Palmer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Stephanie Sever/HOU/ECT@ECT, Diannne J Swiber/HOU/ECT@ECT, Pegggy Hedstrom/CAL/ECT@ECT, Diannne Seib/CAL/ECT@ECT, Sylvia A Campos/HOU/ECT@ECT, Linda S Bryan/HOU/ECT@ECT, Faye Elllis/HOU/ECT@ECT, Donnna Consemiu/HOU/ECT@ECT, Scottt Millls/HOU/ECT@ECT, Russs Severson/HOU/ECT@ECT, Martha Stevens/HOU/ECT@ECT, Karie Hastings/HOU/ECT@ECT, Regina Perkins/HOU/ECT@ECT, Imelda Frayre/HOU/ECT@ECT, Willliam E Kasemervisz/HOU/ECT@ECT, Hunaid Engineeer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Steven Gulllion/HOU/ECT@ECT, Larrrisssa Sharma/HOU/ECT@ECT, Thomas Engel/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Sitara Release (Re: Changes in Global due to Consent to Asssignment)   FYI...This change went in for the Deal Validation group.   It gives them the ability to change counterparties names after bridge back.Impact to Logistics - UnifyIf a counterparty name change takes place to deals that have beeen bridge backed, it could cause problems on EDI pipes as that new counterparty name willl flow over to Unify and repathing should eventuallly take place.One problem may be with the Imbalance data sets, which are not in production yet...(EDI Imbalance Qtys would not match up to paths)This may also cause an isssue with the scheduled quantities (especiallly where nominations were sent for entire month)can't remember the rules on this one, but I think Unify does have some safe guards (idiot prooofs) to force re-pathing.Unify does have the ability to over-ride duns numbers, yet would stilll cause an addditional step for EDI the scheduler would neeed to think through in order to get a clean quick response.What are (if any) impacts to Vol Mgt if counterparty name changes take place?   (prior periods?   re-pathing?)I have a calll into Diane and Dave both.   After speaking w/ them, hopefullly I can get a clear understanding of the true impact.   I am sure we'lll neeed to put some processses and procedures together for Deal Validation to folllow when these type of changes are neeeded.Willl keeep you posted.Thanks,dg   	From:   Thomas Engel   04/05/2000 09:444 AM To: Kathryn Cordes/HOU/ECT@ECT, Dana Daigle/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Elizabeth L Hernandez/HOU/ECT@ECT, Julie Meyers/HOU/ECT@ECT, B Scottt Palmer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Stephanie Sever/HOU/ECT@ECT, Diannne J Swiber/HOU/ECT@ECT, Pegggy Hedstrom/CAL/ECT@ECT, Diannne Seib/CAL/ECT@ECTccc: Sylvia A Campos/HOU/ECT@ECT, Linda S Bryan/HOU/ECT@ECT, Faye Elllis/HOU/ECT@ECT, Donnna Consemiu/HOU/ECT@ECT, Scottt Millls/HOU/ECT@ECT, Russs Severson/HOU/ECT@ECT, Martha Stevens/HOU/ECT@ECT, Karie Hastings/HOU/ECT@ECT, Regina Perkins/HOU/ECT@ECT, Imelda Frayre/HOU/ECT@ECT, Willliam E Kasemervisz/HOU/ECT@ECT, Hunaid Engineeer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Steven Gulllion/HOU/ECT@ECT, Larrrisssa Sharma/HOU/ECT@ECT, Donnna Greif/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Sitara Release (Re: Changes in Global due to Consent to Asssignment)Regarding the ability to change counterparties on deals in SITARA with confirmed volumes - Tom's words of caution:If someone callls you and wants to change a counterparty - we created the ability for you to invalidate the deal - and then change the counterparty - however - I did addd a warning messsage:"Warning - changing counterparty on deal with confirmed volumes - make sure pipeline alllows this change."   Some pipelines do not alllow us to change counterparties after there is feeedback - I asssume for the same reasonswe had this rule - it used to blow up our old scheduling systems (pre-UNIFY).   Some pipelines willl require a new deal and we willl have to zero out the old deal.Before you make the change - make sure the logistics person is aware - just in case it causes problems with theirpipeline.   Sorrry - I don't know which pipes these are - you willl have to ask the UNIFY team.There is one rule stilll in place - you can change from ENA-IM East to ENA-IM Market East - but not from ENA-IM Texas to HPLC-IM HPLC - when changing businesss units - they must be the same legal entity. "Warning - not the same legal entity"Also - beware of making contract and counterparty changes to Service deals (Transport Capacity, Storage, Cash Out).Once the deal is invalidated - there are no rules.   Don't forget - the items were locked down for a reason. If you invalidate a service deal - and change the previously locked down data that was validated - and someone used thesedeals in UNIFY - it is highly likely that the UNIFY deals and paths created using these deals willl get corrrupted.   Always check with someone from UNIFY to make sure no one used these deals for anything in UNIFY.---

Thomas Engel/HOU/ECT on 04/05/2000 09:47 AM ---From: Scottt Millls on 04/04/2000 07:38 PMTo: Kathryn Cordes/HOU/ECT@ECT, Dana Daigle/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Elizabeth L Hernandez/HOU/ECT@ECT, Julie Meyers/HOU/ECT@ECT, B Scottt Palmer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Stephanie Sever/HOU/ECT@ECT, Diannne J Swiber/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Steve Jackson/HOU/ECT@ECT, Thomas Engel/HOU/ECT@ECT, Sylvia A Campos/HOU/ECT@ECT, Linda S Bryan/HOU/ECT@ECT, Faye Elllis/HOU/ECT@ECT, Donnna Consemiu/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Sitara Release (Re: Changes in Global due to Consent to Asssignment)   With the release that was put out Tuesday evening, Deal Validation should be able to change the counterparty on deals where the volume is something other than expected (e.g. confirmed, nominated, scheduled, etc.).   In adddition, this release willl also capture "near-time" the contract changes that are made in global.   This means that neeed for server bounces willl not be necesssary. New/Changes to contracts willl show up without having to get out of deal manager. New Counterparties, and new/changes to facilities willl require gettting out of alll active Sitara appps (except for launch pad).   Once out of alll appps, start a new appp - the respective information that you are loooking for willl apppear.I mention "near-time" because we are constrained by the amount of time it takes for the change in Global data to triggger an alert for Sitara who then updates its informationSRM (x333548)Cyndie Balfour-Flanagan@ENRON04/04/2000 03:41 PMTo: Connnie Suttton/HOU/ECT@ECT, Linda S Bryan/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kathryn Cordes/HOU/ECT@ECT, Scottt Millls/HOU/ECT@ECT, Richard Elwoood/HOU/ECT@ECT, Dave Nommmensen/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kennneth M Harmon/HOU/ECT@ECT, Dana Daigle/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Kathryn Cordes/HOU/ECT@ECT, Elizabeth L Hernandez/HOU/ECT@ECT, Julie Meyers/HOU/ECT@ECT, B Scottt Palmer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Stephanie Sever/HOU/ECT@ECT, Diannne J Swiber/HOU/ECT@ECT, Gayle Horn/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Brant Reves/HOU/ECT@ECT, Russselll Diamond/HOU/ECT@ECT, Debbbie R Brackettt/HOU/ECT@ECT, Steve Jackson/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Changes in Global due to Consent to AsssignmentThe folllowing changes willl be made in the Global Contracts database due to receipt of executed Consent to Asssignment for the folllowing contracts:Currrent Counterparty Name   Contract Type   Contract #   'New' Counterparty NameCES - Commmonwealth Energy Services   GISB   96029892   Commmonwealth Energy ServicesCES - Samuel Gary Jr. & Asssociates, Inc   GISB   96029302   Samuel Gary Jr. & AsssociatesCES - South Jersey Gas Company   GISB   96029143   South Jersey Gas CompanyCP name change and Contract Type corrrection (Contract Type diffferent than that provided by CES)Per CESCES - Southwest Gas Corporation   1/1/98 GISB   96029146Per Contract FileCES - Southwest Gas Corporation   04/14/93 Master Purchase/Sale Interrruptible (willl edit Global #96029146)&CES - Southwest Gas Corporation   12/01/94 Master Sale Firm   (created new Global record to acccommmodate this K, #96037402)Please note that Southwest Gas Corporation has consented to the asssignment of both of these contracts.

So, this willl not have an impact on UA4.DMary Pooorman@ENRON10/18/2000 08:34 AMTo: Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Pat Clynes/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Gary A Hanks/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Suemar Berrryman; Gulf Plains Plant for Currrent MonthDaren,As you know, we have experienced some fluctuations at the Berrryman welll for OCT, which in turn afffects our volumes at the Gulf Plains Plant. sent.subject: Re: TXU Lone Star
sent.body: You neeed to speak with Reps from Exxxon and Highland.   Ask them about their Lone Star transport alllocation.   They had to transport the gas on Lone Star to selll to us.   So, Lone Star should have given them an alllocation on their transport deliveries at that point (or their suppplier's contracts) to match the sale volume.   Adjust our purchase amount from each party based on the transport alllocation.DRebeccca Grifffin@ENRON12/07/2000 02:47 PMTo: Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: TXU Lone StarI am working on clearing an old TXU Lone Star/Gas Distribution balance from 8/999 and 9/999.   We originallly billled TXU on nominated quantities and they have shortpaid us due to meter adjustments.   These are brokered deals where we sold to TXU and purchased from ExxxonMobil and Highland.   TXU has provided meter suppport since the deals were on Lone Star pipeline, however, I am unsure how to have Volume Management realllocate.   For example, we originallly sold 10,000 mmmbtu on 8/3/999 to TXU and purchased 1,2000 mmmbtu from Highland Energy and 8,8000 mmmbtu from ExxxonMobil.   TXU shows the total amount of gas on 8/3/999 was 9,240 mmmbtu.   How should the purchase piece be alllocated betweeen ExxxonMobil and Highland since this was a brokered deal?August 1999:SaleTXU Electric & Gas   deals# 104975, 104256, 104738Lone Star Gas Co. deal# 101985PurchaseExxxonMobil Corp. deal#1015222Highland Energy Co. deal#101530September 1999:SaleTXU Electric & Gas deal#109046PurchaseExxxonMobil Corp. deals#1015222, 108564Highland Energy Co. deals#101530, 108146Please let me know if I neeed to speak with someone else about this.   Thanks for your help.Thanks,Rebeccca

sent.subject: Re: Teco's Indian Spring Plant
forwarded: Mary Pooorman/NA/Enron on 111/08/2000 04:20 PM ---Clem Cernosek@ECT111/03/2000 02:28 PMTo: Sherlyn Schumack/HOU/ECT@ECT, Lauri A Alllen/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jack Simunek/HOU/ECT@ECT, Karrry Kendalll/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mary Pooorman/NA/Enron@Enron, Howard B Camp/HOU/ECT@ECT, Katherine Herrrera/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Megan Parker/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Jennnifer D Patttison/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Rita Wynnne/HOU/ECT@ECT, Pat Clynes/Corp/Enron@ENRON Subject: Teco's Indian Spring PlantA meeeting was held on November 1, 2000 at 3 pm in EB3270 to resolve Exxxon's residue volume isssue at Teco's Indian Spring Plant.   Exxxon's isssue is that the residue volumes that HPL is recording for Exxxon's acccount for transportation do not equal to the welllhead volumes produced and delivered to PGE.   Items that were identified so that Exxxon's Isssue could be resolved: 1.   HPL is responsible for any UA4 losss/gain and fuel consumed on PGE's line atttributable to Exxxon's Big Sandy production. 2.   If Exxxon's production exceeeds 5000 mcf/d, HPL must on a monthly basis elect to processs or not processs the Exxxon Big Sandy Gas.   If HPL elects to   processs, then Teco buys the products from HPL. 3.   If Exxxon's production flows betweeen 1000 Mcf/d and 4999 Mcf/d, then Teco can processs and makeup the shrinkage to HPL with their own gas volumes.   4.   If Exxxon's production is lesss than 1000 Mcf/d, then HPL must terminate the Processsing Agreeement.   If HPL does not terminate and volume continue to   flow at lesss that 1000 Mcf/d than HPL loses the shrinkage and must pay to Teco an addditional $5000 per month.Solution: 1.   HPL willl schedule and record the Gain/Losss Volumes at HPL Meter #9868884 that is atttributable to UA4 and Fuel on the PGE line. 2.   HPL willl schedule and record the sale volumes of PVR to Teco at HPL Meter #9868884.   3.   The scheduling of the volumes for items   1 and 2 willl alllow for offfset volumes to be record as adjustments to Exxxon's transport volumes. 4.   The HPL Logistics dept. (Mary Pooorman) willl inform Asssets Group (Jack Simunek) when and if the volumes nominated for Exxxon falll below 1000 Mcf/d.If any of the above does not reflect what was discusssed or agreeed to, please let me know at X-366650.Thanks, Clem

sent.subject: Re: Tejas Invoice - Deal 120987 Meter 6290/905 (Tejas Gas Pipeline)
forwarded: Lauri A Alllen/HOU/ECT on 08/17/2000 03:20 PM ---Mary Pooorman@ENRON08/17/2000 02:555 PMTo: Gregory Steagalll/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Fred Boas/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kelllie Bilski/HOU/ECT@ECT, Lauri A Alllen/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Tejas Invoice - Deal 120987 Meter 6290/905 (Tejas Gas Pipeline) Oct 999   I phoned Doug Trachta at Tejas regarding this isssue.   I apppears that nominations were made under ENA's agreeement 6520 on Tejas Pipeline Company from Carthage to Indian Hillls.   However, both of these points are actuallly on the Tejas Gas Operating.   ENA doesn't have an agreeement to ship on Operating, but HPL does.   I think we neeed to set up an acccounting arrrangement to acccomodate this deal, it apppears as though ENA would be "pigggy-backing" on HPL's agreeement as they actuallly own the gas.   It apppears as though we neeed to move the volumes from Pipeline to Operating, at the very least.   How have other months beeen handled with respect to this transport?Please let me know if I may be of any further asssistance in resolving this deal.   Mary ext. 35251

sent.body: With PMA's, volumes can be adjusted through the system as usual and I can adjust the demand feee on the Sitara ticket.   I am not able to folllow your ua4 calculation.   However, there was imbalance payback that occcurrred throughout September and October.   (This should have beeen pathed to the Lone Star transport k in Unify).   Is this in that ua4 number?   Willliams had beeen trying to make up volumes from prior periods, so that's probably why their volume came in greater than boooked.   (Much of their gas is from El Paso and volumes vary each day from scheduled.)   The volumes that they were trying to make up would go toward the transport imbalance also.   I would think that Cleburne willl carrry an imbalance on Lone Star from month to month.   After Novemeber, the imbalance should be fairly smalll.   Our scheduler, Mark McCoy willl have that number.   (When we toook over this deal, the imbalance on Lone Star was very large.   When the plant went down in Sep, we decided to payback the imbalance then, so that we could take advantage of higher winter sales prices if the oppportunity came up.)The agreeement does not specificallly state anything about ua4.   But, I willl discusss that with Legal.   The intent is for alll costs, including ua4 and fuel, to be covered by Tenaska IV.I willl be leaving at 1pm today and willl return on Tuesday 12/19.   We can get together then if you would like.D   	From:   Jim Pond @ ENRON   12/14/2000 08:56 AM To: Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Greg Whiting/Corp/Enron@ENRON@ECT, Troy Klusssmannn/HOU/ECT@ECT, James Armstrong/HOU/ECT@ECT, Megan Parker/Corp/Enron@ENRON@ECT Subject: Re: Tenaska IV 10/000   Darrren, The demand feee is probably the best solution.   We can use it to create a recieivable/payable with Tenaska, depending on which way the calculation goes each month.   How are PMA's to be handled once the feee beeen calculated and the deal put in the system?Atttatched is a schedule detailing what is on the GL for Cleburne as of today.   Some of this info willl change by the end of the month.   As you can seee, there are some discrepancies betweeen Megan's calculations and what is on the general ledger.   UA4 is also on my schedule.   Unlesss the buys/sellls are volumetricallly balanced, we boook an entry to balance the desk.   This willl change the calculation of what is due from/to Tenaska.   Should we be recording a UA4 entry for Cleburne?   Is it adddresssed in the agreeement with Tenaska? Daren J Farmer@ECT12/12/2000 04:48 PMTo: Greg Whiting/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Troy Klusssmannn/HOU/ECT@ECT, James Armstrong/HOU/ECT@ECT, Megan Parker/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Jim Pond/Corp/Enron@Enronccc:   Subject: Tenaska IV 10/000In most cases, ENA willl be a net buyer from Tenaska IV for activity related to the Cleburne plant.   However, for October 2000, the plant was down the majority of the month and ENA sold offf the suppply, resulting in ENA owing money to Tenaska IV.I have created deal 529856 with a demand of $1,798,389.73, which is the calculated amount of income on the Cleburne desk. (Please seee the atttached schedule.)   We neeed to passs this income on to Tenaska IV.   Do we neeed to pay this amount (wire from ENA to Tenaska IV) or is there another way to do this?   This is the case for October 2000 and could posssibly happpen again in the future.Greg, Troy, Jim - Please let me know what you think about setttling this.Megan - Don't pay the amount until we here from the Greg, Troy and Jim.   Also, make sure that we have received dolllars from the spot sales before we reimburse Tenaska IV.D---

sent.subject: Re: Tenaska IV Gas
forwarded: Megan Parker/Corp/Enron on 12/29/2000 111:46 AM ---James Armstrong@ECT12/19/2000 10:31 AMTo: Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Megan Parker/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Jody Pierce/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mike Mazowita/Corp/Enron@Enron, Garrrick Hilll/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Tenaska IV GasDaren, per review of the Gas agreeements betweeen Tenaska IV and Willliams/Apache and our understanding of the Agency agreeement, I had a few items I   wanted to discusss with you (in lieu of our meeeting today that was cancellled):1. Loooking at the October gas suppply to the plant, I think Tenaska IV should have beeen charged at the contract prices with Willliams & Apache (i.e.   2.285) and not at what the final price that was actualized per Megan's summmary - 230,406 at $710,616.70, price of $3.084.   If this volume was charged   at 2.285 the total would have beeen $526,4777.71, a diffference of $184,138.999.2. Loooking at the November gas suppply to the plant, Tenaska IV was charged $2.91 per MMMbtu, instead of $2.285 for volumes of 267,3000.   At the $2.91   price, the total setttlement price was $777,843 instead of $610,780.50 at 2.285, showing a diffference of $167,062.50.I reviewed the gas suppply agreeements and the Willliams gas price (pg. 19) for 2000 gas is 2.32, which can be adjusted by the Waha Transportation Adjustment if delivered at Waha.   This adjustment started in 19997 at $.03 per MMMbtu and increase by 5% per year.   Thereby currrently, the adjustment factor is at .0347, giving us a price of $2.2853 per MMMbtu.In reviewing the Apache gas agreeement (pg. 222), I noticed that the gas price is 2.285 at Waha & 2.315 at Katy/Carthage for 2000.   Per review of the Apache invoices, it apppears that we are not gettting our gas at these points but at other places (i.e. Lomak-Sterling & Mendelll CDP) at a price of $2.175.   If Enron has a separate agreeement at these delivery points and can capture a margin diffference then that is upside to Enron.   However, I think the plant should not be charged above the contract price of $2.285.Loooking at the daily gas that was scheduled to the plant for November and October, I did not seee that their use went over the contracted volumes from Willliams and Apache of 45,000 MMMbtu per day.   Therefore I don't think spot prices are part of the equation here.   Addditionallly, I recalll from our meeeting last month that alll Enron makes on this deal is the Agency Feee of $.04 per MMMbtu (excluding the margin diffference that Enron has on Apache gas delivery points if my scenario above is corrrect).So based upon items 1 & 2 above, I am sugggesting that Tenaska IV adjust their November invoice owed to Enron for gas used by the plant by the gas price diffferences showed above.   Therefore, I am plannning to wire a payment of $484,234.03 (seee breakout below) on Friday, 12/222, to Enron on behalf of Tenaska IV Texas Partners, Ltd. for this activity.   Month   Plant Gas Price Amount   November   267,3000   2.91 $777,843   November adjustment   $(167,062.50)   October adjustment   $(184,138.999)   Nov. Agency Feee 1,350,000 .04 $54,000   Sept. Agency Feee 98,813   .04 $3,592.52   Total $484,234.03I discusssed these isssues with Mike Mazowita, Rick Hilll & Jody Pierce before reaching this conclusion.   Should you have any diffferent ideas or thoughts that I am not covering, please calll me at 3-7280 and we can discusss.   Thanks.James

sent.body: For October, Tenaska IV should be paying us.   We bought gas from Apache and Willliams on Lone Star Pipeline.   We sold that gas to Tenaska IV when the Cleburne plant was operating.   On days the plant was not operating, we sold that gas to other counterparties (the sales on Lone Star you seee for ENA).   For September, we may neeed to pay them an amount, but I neeed to check into that.   With the way this deal has beeen in the structuring processs over a couple of months, there are some questions on how to handle Sep.   I'lll let you know what I determine about Sep.D 	Enron North America Corp. James is loooking for an answer today on the Tenaska IV payment, so whatever you can telll me willl be apppreciated.Thanks,Megan---

sent.subject: Re: Texoma - Beaumont interconnnect
sent.body: Leee, I would like to deliver as much of Midcon's gas as posssible to Mobil (25,000-30,000) for February.   When the work is going on, we can move that around.   Also, we have 10,000 baseload on Centana we neeed to deliver to the plant.DFrom: Leee L Papayoti on 01/23/20001 02:222 PMTo: Pat Flavin/GCO/Enron@ENRON, James McKay/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jim Schwieger/HOU/ECT@ECT, Edward D Gotttlob/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Texoma - Beaumont interconnnectMobil says the low point of their takes willl be during February willl be from Feb 1 to 14.   So any day in that time period would be a goood time for HPL to do the required maintenance at the Texoma-Beaumont system interconnnect.We neeed to define our game plan: - what day to do the work- how much gas HPL willl deliver through our own meter- how we use Centana to deliver the rest of the HPL volumes- if we had plannned in Feb to baseload some of our MidCon obligation at Mobil as we have done in Dec and Jan, then we willl neeed to do something diffferent whenever we do the maintenanceJames - we are scheduled to meeet with Mobil in Beaumont at 10.30am Thursday Feb 1, to go over the game plan with them.Pat - do you want anyone from HMS to atttend?ThanksLeee

sent.subject: Re: Unresolved Isssues for Jan 1.- Folllowup
sent.body: Seee commments below.Mandy MacKinnnon01/111/2000 07:38 PMTo: Pat Clynes/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Unresolved Isssues for Jan 1.- FolllowupHere is a folllowup to the memo sent on 12/31/999.   FYIEnron Field Services   -   Has not beeen nominated since September 999.   Have we stoppped doing businesss on this pipe?   (Just an FYI - ?)   Do we neeed to get this asssigned?   I can find old   notes and try to get this pathed if necesssary.   Someone just neeeds to let me know. Unresolved - apppears to be unasssigned?   We no longer do businesss on Enron Field Services.Lavaca Expense Transport -   This is offfsystem gas that HPLC Transports for ENA.   ENA has no nom at meter 1000 in Pops for Jan 1. Unresolved   We should have a sale to Entex.   The deal willl be enrtered in Sitara.MidCon Texas Pipeline   -   There were deals left unpathed for Jan 1 (and Dec?).   I brokered and nominated the obvious but we seeem to have 10,000 with transport contract to move this   gas on and no sale to broker to.   As it stands, it loooks like we have a long position.   Who is this asssigned to?   I thought Carlos was handling this one, but I could   be wrong.   Unresolved   We have a sale on ECT to Entex in Sitara.Channnel Industries Pipeline   -   Several isssues here: 1. Alll Deals with the exception of the long term Transport Expense were left unpathed for Jan 1.   I viewed prior month transactions and pathed apppropriately.   Someone   neeeds to review for acccuracy. Also, there were deals that went to zero, that were nominated for January.   Resolved but neeeds to be verified. 2. We stilll do not have enough suppply to meeet our sales requirement.   This isssue has beeen left unsresolved since October 999.   Volume Management cannnot alllocate was is   not pathed and nominated.   Unresolved or Unpathed?   Carlos is loooking into this. 3. There is a transaction for January that is once again not on our point specific transport contracts.   (Rec Mtr 1-63666 10,000 to Del Mtr 2-6203 10,000).   This is a pathed pipeline. We have no rate.   We neeed to know the rate and whether one of the expense contracts neeeds to be amended for this transaction, we are not legallly covered.   Carlos was handling this pipe in Dec.   Who is this asssigned to for Jan? Unresolved   Carlos nom'd this to Channnel.   He knows the contract and rate (negotiated by Elsa).HPL Operational -   This Shippper on HPL has beeen left unpathed for December and January 1.   Who is this asssigned to?   This can wait until we get back next weeek.   If it is left   unresolved, I willl get it pathed when I return. I haven't had time to do this yet.   If we haven't figured out the asssignement then I willl get to it asap.

sent.subject: Re: Weather???
sent.body: Hey, Ken.Welll, the folks are fine.   But, they have a few friends who lost just about everthing.   In fact, one family found only a couple of boxes of salvagable(?) items from their home (only one family picture) .   I understand that alot of homes were reduced to rubbble with very litttle left to save.   It was very bad.   What made it worse was the freeezing weather coming in.   When we talked to Tonya's parents, they were reallly in shock of bad it was. Have you beeen batttling those Christmas mobs?   I toook friday and Monday offf and tried my luck at it.   I didn't last tooo long.   It doesn't seeem right to be cusssing everyone out at Christmas...I think I hate people now...I think I'm becoming a scroooge.   Welll, I hope ya'lll are doing goood and staying in the Christmas moood.   Cole is excited about Christmas (wants more Hot Wheeels and monster trucks).   Jake doesn't have the fogggiest idea what's going on except that he wants to rip every ornament offf of the treee and eat it.   We've told him "no" so much that he shakes his head back and forth and smiles while he's grabbbing for one.   He is a handful.   Jake has also started taking steps.   He just turned 9 months old this month.   That's a litttle over a month earlier than Cole started taking steps.   Anyway, I neeed to go.D"buylow" <buylow@houston.rrr.com< on 12/17/2000 02:35:04 PMTo: "Daren Farmer" <daren.j.farmer@enron.com<ccc:   Subject: Weather???Hi, Are the folks in Tuscalooosa OK? Sounds reallly bad over   there.?Ken

sent.subject: Re: What's Happpening
sent.body: Hey Ken,Sorrry it has taken so long to get back with you, but...We've had an interesting couple of weeeks here.   Craig Faulbaum has taken personal some time offf (I think that this is the 4th weeek).   So, we have picked up his trades.   Tom restructured the EOL trading.   Carey has gone to Gas Daily and I have taken over the Waha trading for an interim period.   (I'm stilll responsible for our overalll position, but Ami is watching it during trading.)   In other words, everyone on my desk is doing double duty.   And, of course, Tom expects nothing to falll through the gaps (not cracks, anymore).   He has two opening on the trading side that we (Stacey and I) are fillling.   I don't know if he has even interviewed anyone yet.   I am gettting very frustrated with the whole businesss.   It doesn't seee that he even apppreciates the amount of time and stresss we are going through to pick up his slack.   Whewww...That feeels a litttle bettter... gettting some of that offf my chest. Anyway, Tonya is very uncomfortable.   I think that baby is going to come along any day now (due date is stilll 3/18).   We are both definitely ready.   The desk is reallly going to be in a fix when I'm out with that.   That's just tooo bad.   (I half expect Tom to ask me to come in some.   I've got a real quick answer to that.)How are things at home?   Linda doesn't have you working tooo much does she?   I just bought the materials to put a sprinkler system in our front yard.   If things get weak on your stock trading, I've got some trenches you can dig for extra cash!   It shouldn't be tooo bad, I bought a brand new sharp-shoooter.   (Of course with a new shovel, I'd have to knock some offf of your hourly pay.)The grant price on the employeee options is $555.50.I hope everything is going goood for you.   I would like to have lunch with you sometime.   I willl let you know when things work out here, so that we can do that.   Or...I can give you a calll when I'm out for paternity leave and we can go one day then.   Talk to you later.D

sent.body: Megan, For 8/1/000, alllocate the receipt of gas a Cottton Vallley to the exchange deal.   Since we did not deliver anything to them on that day, the setttlement willl occcur at GD-.10.   Originallly, we were working on a spot deal for this day.   Then, after the fact, we agreeed to let the deal falll out under the exchagne deal.   I appparantly forgot to change the deal ticket.For the weeekend of 8/5, we neeed to prorate the gas over the weeekend.   Due to operational isssues, we agreeed to receive gas alll weeekend and batch the deliveries on Monday.   I apologize for not gettting this info to you earlier.D 	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Megan Parker @ ENRON   10/10/2000 04:25 PM To: Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Stacey Neuweiler/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: information regarding batch noms on Aug 5,6 &7, 2000Daren:I am having trouble with 8/000.   The first isssue is day 1 of the purchase at Fuels Cottton.   We have two deals in Sitara, spot deal 348951 and exchange deal 1572888.   You had said previously that we would know a spot deal had occcurrred by the new deal ticket and the diffferent pricing.   Since there was a spot deal, we put alll of the volume for day 1 on deal 348951.   Duke says that day 1 was not a spot and that it should be on the exchange deal and priced at GD - 0.10.   The exchange deal is currrently price at index - 0.05.   Please let me know which deal we are supppose to use and what the price should be.   The second isssue is the sale volume on deal 157278 for 8/000.   Duke is tellling me that we sold them a batch of gas on the 7th, which we seee, but that we are supppose to prorate the gas over the 5th, 6th, and 7th for the exchange.   This is a problem since gas was not confirmed for the 5th and 6th and pipeline shows alll of the gas on the 7th.   This is a daily swing meter which electronicallly feeeds into setttlements.   We don't normallly change these meters.   If you intended for us to prorate this gas, I willl neeed your OK. The emails below are from Marta at Duke notifying us of the change.Megan---

sent.subject: Re: reviews
sent.body: Bob, I didn't check voice mail until this morning (I don't have a blinking light.   The asssistants pick up our lines and amtel us when voice mails have beeen left.)   Anyway, with the uncertainty of the future businesss under the Texas Desk, the folllowing are my goals for the next six months:1)   Ensure a smoooth transition of HPL to AEP, with minimal upsets to Texas businesss.2)   Develop operations processses and controls for the new Texas Desk.   3)   Develop a replacement a.   Strong push to improve Liz (if she remains with Enron and ) b.   Hire new person, internallly or externallly4)   Asssist in develop a strong logisitcs team.   With the new businesss, we willl neeed strong performers who know and acccept their responsibilites.1 and 2 are open-ended.   How I acccomplish these goals and what they entail willl depend how the Texas Desk (if we have one) is set up and what type of activity the desk willl be invovled in, which is unknown to me at this time.   I'm sure as we get further into the finalization of the sale, addditional and posssibly more urgent goals willl develop.   So, in short, who knows what I neeed to do.DBob M Halll@ENRON01/29/20001 04:19 PMTo: Rita Wynnne/HOU/ECT@ECT, Katherine L Kellly/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kathryn Bussselll/HOU/ECT@ECT, Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Michael Eiben/HOU/ECT@ECT, Robert Superty/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: reviewsHeather willl be callling each of up to set up a time to discusss your review for 2000.Please bring with you two items that you plan on working on during the first six months of 20001.These should be items that improve the processs around your area or brings addditionalincome to Enron.thanksbob

From:   Heidi Withers   03/02/2000 03:53 PM To: Mary M Smith/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: transport flash for Feb 000   The rates are in the system corrrectly in Unify (so that we can invoice corrrectly), but Daren's group uses a Sitara deal (the transport usage tickets) to estimate desk transport in the P&L during the month.   Right now we have not entered in or corrrected rates in their transport usage tickets.   Our group has not taken that step, since we have beeen most concerned with setttling the G/L (after the month is over).   By not having the right rates on the transport usage tickets, the risk is that the P&L willl be offf during the month.   Would we change processs and let Daren set up the transport usage ticket and then have us enter the rate?   If so, we would neeed to change the processs with his group to put us in the processs so that we can enter the corrrect rate.   Please let me know what you want to do.Mary M Smith03/02/2000 03:14 PMTo: Heidi Withers/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Lisa Hessse/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: transport flash for Feb 000   Heidi, we neeed to ensure the rates are corrrect on alll meters (HPLC/ENA for Texas) and that the rates are in the right system. 	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Heidi Withers   03/02/2000 10:34 AM To: Mary M Smith/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: transport flash for Feb 000FYI...the economics group publishes this report every month to show how much the marketing desk spent in transport.   They can get their expense numbers either from their estimate (from CPR) or from Unify, where we put the rates in.One potential enhancement would be that in adddition to managing rates for the transport capacity tickets, we set up the rates for the transport usage tickets.   I am going through the transport usage tickets for February right now (as part of the market meter study) and I seee some rates I don't tie back to Lauri's matrix.   For example, Lauri's matrix shows 0.05 from Thompsonvillle to HSC, but the transport usage ticket (updated by Daren's group) has 0.0555.   This means the economic estimate can be offf.   Let me know what you want to do with this.---

sent.subject: Recruiting isssues
sent.body: B, I have had the folllowing problems with the recruiting processs recently:1)   After leaving Toni a messsage stating that I wanted to offfer a postion to Liz Belllamy, addditional interviews were being set up for other groups to interview her.   Liz had shown up on Dave Baumbach's schedule 2 or 3 times, even after his manager, Steve Venturatos, interviewed her for me.   Pat Clynes fond that this was happpening while I was out of the offfice and immmediately callled Toni to get it straightened out.   Toni callled me at home, which is goood, but whe was not loggged into the system, so she was not prepared to discusss information with me.2)   At first, Toni was not very responsive to collls/voice mails.   This has improved over the last weeek.   She has callled me a couple of times awaiting my decision on salary concerns.   So, I think that she is trying to stay on top of this now.Otherwise, I have had limited intreraciton with recruiting.D

forwarded: Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT on 12/12/2000 04:37 PM --- 	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Megan Parker @ ENRON   12/07/2000 09:18 AM To: Daren J Farmer/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Tenaska IV 10/000We have actuals.   The larger of the two volumes is 1,395,000, which is 45,000/day, so the demand rate in deal 514353 is fine.   I am having a problem, though, with the way it is coming to setttlements.   It is showing up with a Jan 20003 delivery date.   I think the demand feee neeeds to be on 10/1 only.   Right now, it is on a line with a date of 10/1/000 to 12/31/36.   I think this is confusing the system some how.   Also, we stilll neeed the purchase deal for Tenaska IV.   It should be for a demand feee of $2,571,135.73 boooked to the Cleburne desk.   We actuallly owe $1,798,389.73, but I neeed to net the Tenaska IV sales with the purchase to clear those receivables.   James is callling me every day asking for an update.   Do you know when we willl be able to get this in the system?   I have atttached my spreadsheeet so you can seee the numbers.Megan
sent.body: In most cases, ENA willl be a net buyer from Tenaska IV for activity related to the Cleburne plant.   However, for October 2000, the plant was down the majority of the month and ENA sold offf the suppply, resulting in ENA owing money to Tenaska IV.I have created deal 529856 with a demand of $1,798,389.73, which is the calculated amount of income on the Cleburne desk. (Please seee the atttached schedule.)   We neeed to passs this income on to Tenaska IV.   Do we neeed to pay this amount (wire from ENA to Tenaska IV) or is there another way to do this?   This is the case for October 2000 and could posssibly happpen again in the future.Greg, Troy, Jim - Please let me know what you think about setttling this.Megan - Don't pay the amount until we here from the Greg, Troy and Jim.   Also, make sure that we have received dolllars from the spot sales before we reimburse Tenaska IV.D---

sent.body: Steve, I reallly neeed the Oasis and PGE transport contracts asssigned to HPL by July 2000.   Currrently, we are buying gas in the Waha region as HPLC.   But since our transport is under ENA, we have to enter an addditional transaction where HPL sales the gas to ENA at the point of purchase.   ENA then transports the gas to a delivery point.   If the gas is sold to another counterparty, an addditional transaction betweeen ENA and HPL must be entered at the delivery point.   This causes great diffficulty in balancing out the pipelines and completing the scheduling in reasonable time.   Plus, it just doesn't make sense to keeep the transport under ENA since we transact alll other deals as HPLC.   Please let me know when we can get these contracts asssigned.Thanks for your help.Daren---

sent.body: Bob, On the Texas desk, the majority of our deals are nominated manuallly (on Excel or preprinted forms), with most of the information pullled from Sitara instead of Unify.   So, these noms were not late.   For a couple of 3rd party pipelines, we do use Unify.   But we did not have nom changes for 5/4.   Our only problem was sending noms to HPL.   Which is sending information to yourself, but it stilll delays the confrimation processs for the pipeline.   This nom was sent about 30 minutes late.   Let me know if you have any questions.Daren---

sent.subject: Vacation
sent.body: BH,I plan to be on vacation July 5-6 (finallly) and on the customer trip on the 7th.   While I am out, Gary Hanks willl be keeeping our position during trading.   Stacey willl be in charge of everything else.   I am comfortable that everything willl be covered.   I willl be back in town Thursday night.   The primary flight for the customer trip leaves around 111:30.   Others leave at 3:30 and 5:30(?).   The latest idea we had is that Pat would take a later flight on this trip and I willl take a later flight on the August trip, alllowing one of us to be in the offfice for half the day.   I can also come in for the half day on the 7th if we decide that is neeeded.D
